field_description.processed:
The UVA East Asia Center and Department of Sociology will host Yang Zhang, Assistant Professor in the School of International Service at American University, for a talk on his new book manuscript describing "Empire and its Enemies: Ethnicity, Religion, and Rebellions in China's Frontiers, 1850-1873."

Professor Yang Zhangâ€™s research covers the areas in comparative historical sociology, political sociology, contentious politics, political networks, philosophy of the social sciences, and China Studies. His book project examines the emergence and development of large-scale religious and ethnic rebellions in the Qing Empire of China during the mid-19th century. Prof. Zhang has published articles in the American Journal of Sociology, Journal of Historical Sociology, Mobilization, Voluntas, and Research in Social Movements, Conflicts, and Change. He received the Charles Tilly Article Award from the Comparative-Historical Sociology Section of American Sociological Association in 2022.

This lunch seminar, part of UVA's "Assessment of China's Belt and Road Initiative" project, will be held Thursday, February 16, from 12:00 - 1:30 p.m., in New Cabell Hall 236. The event will also be livestreaming on Zoom, available here.
